{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

This repository wants to explore different solutions for the Severstal competition (ended in November 2019) by the Living Lab Research team of IP4FVG, the Digital Innovation Hub of Friuli Venezia Giulia.

Install

To install this package you need to fullfill the following requirements.

  1. make sure to install properly the pytorch (pytorch installation) and fastai (fastai installation) packages.

  2. download the data from Kaggle. If this is the first time with the API, you'll need a Kaggle account. Then follow this link to understand how to download the credentials in the repository directory kaggle.json file.

  3. run the following cell code (if is not already done)

{% raw %} 
!cp kaggle.json ~/.kaggle/kaggle.json
{% endraw %}

Now you're ready to install the Kaggle API with:

{% raw %} 
!pip install kaggle
{% endraw %}

And then the download and unzip the data with:

{% raw %} 
!kaggle competitions download -c severstal-steel-defect-detection -p {path}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
!unzip -q -n {path}/severstal-steel-defect-detection.zip -d {path}
{% endraw %}

Finally you can install the package with:

git clone https://github.com/marcomatteo/steel-segmentation-nbdev.git
cd steel-segmentation-nbdev
pip install -e .

How to use
